message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<String> iter = set.iterator();
while(iter.hasNext()){
    String key = iter.next();
    Books b = hashmap.get(key);
    System.out.println(b.toString());
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your load() method, you are using the same iterator for every iteration of the loop. This causes the iterator to always point to the first element in the set. To fix this, you need to move the iterator initialization inside the loop and use it to get the key for each iteration. Then, you can use the key to retrieve the corresponding book from the hashmap.
